title: (x) Sleek semiserif face - Philosopher {Tamas Ferencz}
content:
hi, everyone.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202085003im_/http:/typophile.com/files/unknown%20typeface_4307.jpg)
  
can anyone help me id this unknown serif? tia. i tried whatthefont!, but to no avail. 

regards,

JZ
author: metaspace

comments.content:
Interesting typeface. The closest I was able to find was [Ela Demiserif Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202085003/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/ela/demiserif-light/). It's not an exact match but a lot of the feeling is the same.

- Mike Yanega

Another font with some of this elegance is [Kigara](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202085003/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/anatoletype/kigara/regular/characters.html). Still not a match.

- Mike Yanega

Reminds me of [[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/imperial/|URW Imperial] with added serifs.

Andreas

[[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/tema-cantante/|Tema Cantate]] is another close approximation of this one.

Still a mystery.

- Mike Yanega

Given the similarities with Imperial and all the awkwardness (IMHO) of those half-serifs I still believe someone down in China meddled with Imperial.

Andreas

Actually this is a free font called [Philosopher](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202085003/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=philosopher&page=1&nb_ppp_old=50&text=Offer+worship+to+Me&nb_ppp=50&psize=m&classt=alpha).

--- Tamas Ferencz ---

Tamas, good work. That's not giving up on the hunt.

- Mike Yanega
